edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (05:51): for continuity, the above was handled in /msg
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (05:55): so for the CSS value API we need some kind of hashmap and some kind of list
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (05:55): e.g. for 'margin' you need a hashmap and for 'cursor' you'd need a list
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (05:56): the hashmap can be immutable, but the list needs to be mutable

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (05:57): another constrain is that both the hashmap interface and list interface might need to be implemented on the same object in certain scenarios (for backwards compatibility; if something changes from being just a hashmap into a comma-separated list of hashmaps)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (05:57): current sketch I have:
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (05:57): map { mapLength, mapKey(), getter getMapItem() }
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (05:59): list { listLength, insertListItem), deleteListItem(), getter getListItem() }
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (06:00): since getListItem() takes an int and getMapItem() takes a string the getter thing ought to work
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (06:00): thoughts?

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (06:12): http://twitter.com/Bess/status/11402770234 -- 'Tab Atkins says "sexiest" thing in HTML5 is CSS transformation. CSS camp is more peaceful than JS camp. Too much fight over JS camp'
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (06:12): o_O I wonder what was actually said
